results.title: Prevalence and Prognosis of Atenolol-Responsive Systolic Anterior Motion of the Septal Mitral Valve Leaflet in Young Cats with Severe Dynamic Left Ventricular Outflow Tract Obstruction
results.text_hl: Though the owner of one @SPECIES_9685 @@@cat@@@ stopped @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ a year before its @<m>DISEASE_Death</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003643 @@@death@@@, the rest of the @SPECIES_9685 @@@cats@@@ were treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ until their @<m>DISEASE_Death</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003643 @@@deaths@@@.

results.title: Atenolol rescues premature mortality in genetic mouse models of sudden unexpected death in epilepsy.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ was delivered in drinking water to a subset of @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@.

results.title: Ventricular pre-excitation in cats: 17 cases.
results.text_hl: Five @SPECIES_9685 @@@cats@@@ died, all from @<m>DISEASE_Death</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003643 @@@cardiac death@@@ (median survival time 1882 days [2-1882 days]).

results.title: Reduced total mortality and death from myocardial infarction and stroke in moderate/severe hypertensives treated with "Tenormin" (atenolol).
results.text_hl: Reduced total mortality and @<m>DISEASE_Death</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003643 @@@death@@@ from @DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@myocardial infarction@@@ and @DISEASE_Stroke @DISEASE_MESH:D020521 @@@stroke@@@ in moderate/severe @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensives@@@ treated with "@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Tenormin@@@" (@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@).

results.title: Prophylactic atenolol reduces postoperative myocardial ischemia. McSPI Research Group.
results.text_hl: Perioperative @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ administration reduces the risk of @<m>DISEASE_Death</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003643 @@@death@@@ for as long as 2 yr after surgery.

results.title: Acute fatal poisoning with pilsicainide and atenolol.
results.text_hl: According to these results, we concluded that @<m>DISEASE_Death</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003643 @@@death@@@ was due to @DISEASE_Arrhythmias_Cardiac @DISEASE_MESH:D001145 @@@cardiac arrhythmia@@@ caused by @DISEASE_Poisoning @DISEASE_MESH:D011041 @@@poisoning@@@ with @CHEMICAL_pilsicainide @CHEMICAL_MESH:C042288 @@@pilsicainide@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@.

citations.NLM: Hikiji W, Kudo K, Nishida N, Ishida T, Usumoto Y, Tsuji A, Ikeda N. Acute fatal poisoning with pilsicainide and atenolol. Int J Legal Med. 2008 Nov;122(6):503-6. PMID: 18642016

results.title: Survival among patients with left ventricular systolic dysfunction treated with atenolol.
results.text_hl: After adjustment for the propensity to be treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ actually treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ had a significantly lower risk of @<m>DISEASE_Death</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003643 @@@death@@@ compared with treatment with @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol tartrate@@@ and comparable outcome to those treated with @CHEMICAL_Carvedilol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077261 @@@carvedilol@@@.

citations.NLM: Kapoor JR, Heidenreich PA. Survival among patients with left ventricular systolic dysfunction treated with atenolol. Congest Heart Fail. 2009 Sep-Oct;15(5):213-7. PMID: 19751421

results.title: Diazepam-atenolol combination antagonizes aminophylline-induced convulsions and lethality in mice.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Diazepam @CHEMICAL_MESH:D003975 @@@Diazepam@@@ (10 mg/kg) and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (5 mg/kg) administered together gave total protection against @DISEASE_Seizures @DISEASE_MESH:D012640 @@@convulsions@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Death</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003643 @@@death@@@.

citations.NLM: Chugh Y, Chakrabarti A, Sharma PL. Diazepam-atenolol combination antagonizes aminophylline-induced convulsions and lethality in mice. Eur J Pharmacol. 1991 Jun 18;199(1):135-7. PMID: 1893924

results.title: Atenolol, but not mexiletine, protects against stimulus-induced ventricular tachycardia in a chronic canine model.
results.text_hl: In the placebo group, repeated PES challenge resulted in the consistent induction of @DISEASE_Tachycardia_Ventricular @DISEASE_MESH:D017180 @@@ventricular tachycardias@@@ (@DISEASE_Tachycardia_Ventricular @DISEASE_MESH:D017180 @@@VT@@@) in 4/6 @SPECIES_9615 @@@dogs@@@ and @DISEASE_Ventricular_Fibrillation @DISEASE_MESH:D014693 @@@ventricular fibrillation@@@ in 2/6. @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ prevented @DISEASE_Arrhythmias_Cardiac @DISEASE_MESH:D001145 @@@arrhythmia@@@ induction in 4/6 @SPECIES_9615 @@@dogs@@@, one continued to demonstrate a @DISEASE_Tachycardia_Ventricular @DISEASE_MESH:D017180 @@@VT@@@ and one @<m>DISEASE_Death</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003643 @@@died@@@ (P less than 0.05 compared with placebo).

citations.NLM: Uprichard AC, Harron DW. Atenolol, but not mexiletine, protects against stimulus-induced ventricular tachycardia in a chronic canine model. Br J Pharmacol. 1989 Jan;96(1):220-6. PMID: 2924074
citations.BibTeX: @article{2924074, title={Atenolol, but not mexiletine, protects against stimulus-induced ventricular tachycardia in a chronic canine model.}, author={Uprichard AC and Harron DW}, journal={Br J Pharmacol}, volume={96}, number={1}, pages={220-6}}

results.title: Effect of atenolol and reserpine on selected events in the systolic hypertension in the elderly program (SHEP).
results.text_hl: The relative risk for @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ were 0.84 (95% confidence interval: 0.54, 1.30) for @<m>DISEASE_Death</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003643 @@@death@@@, 1.34 (95% confidence interval: 0.80, 2.28) for @DISEASE_Stroke @DISEASE_MESH:D020521 @@@stroke@@@, and 1.07 (95% confidence interval: 0.71, 1.61) for @DISEASE_Cardiovascular_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D002318 @@@CVD@@@.

citations.NLM: Kostis JB, Berge KG, Davis BR, Hawkins CM, Probstfield J. Effect of atenolol and reserpine on selected events in the systolic hypertension in the elderly program (SHEP). Am J Hypertens. 1995 Dec;8(12 Pt 1):1147-53. PMID: 8998247
